{"step_by_step_thinking": "Double reading of barium enemas is a practice where two radiologists independently interpret the same set of images. The purpose of this is to increase the accuracy of the diagnosis by reducing the chance of missing any abnormalities. However, it also increases the time and resources required. The necessity of double reading can depend on various factors such as the complexity of the case, the experience of the radiologist, and the resources available. Therefore, it's not a clear yes or no answer.", "answer_choice": "C. maybe"}
